project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Please allow to manually input Date attribute value in a brand new Edit Object Screen (triggered from object layout view)
fields.summary: Allow to manually input Date attribute value

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h3. Steps:Create or Edit an issue which has Insight custom fields on the screen.From an Insight custom field, create a new object.h3. Expected:Object is created and written as value in the Insight custom field.h3. Actual:Object is created and user must search for and select the newly created object. In the context of creating an Insight object from an Insight custom field in a Jira issue, I think the goal is to write the created object as a value in the field most every time. It's inconvenient and frustrating to users to take the additional step of adding the object to the CF after creating it. It would be a nice improvement to write it after creation.
fields.summary: Write created object to customfield when created from Insight field in issue view

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In 'object types > Export objects', there are options in the Format field - "User friendly" and "Data consistent" which affects the value of username.
For example: * User friendly : Alana Grant* Data consistent : JIRAUSER10100
However, there is no options on the Format when exporting from the Insight Object Search. The search results are exported in the "Data consistent" format and this does not give context to the person that reads the CSV file.  !search_for_objects.png|thumbnail! !csv_export.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the functionality to choose the format when exporting via Object Search. 
h3. Workaround 
No workaround available at this point of time.
fields.summary: Provide format options on Object Search export

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have an object scheme with Customers and Contact. In the Customers we have many attributes like "Customer Number", Adress, Name 1, Name 2, Name 3, etc. The attribute Name 2 is the label.In the Contacts we have also some attributes and an attribute "object" with "Customers" to link the Contact to the Customer.When I view the Contact I can see the label of the Customer. Now I want to see some other attributes of the Customer because the Contact need them too. The following Customers attributes should be shown inside the Contact: * "Customer Number" * Adress * Name 1 * Name 2 (label) * Name 3This is important because I can select the Contacts and I when I export them into CSV I need the information (attributes) from the Customer. Otherwise I can´t use them to create Word-Documents with the Customer Adress and Customer Number.How can I achieve this?Actual when I search for Contact only the Contacts attributes will be exported to CSV and the Customer attributes are empty.
fields.summary: Show other attributes then Label from referenced objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
I would like to be able to Import a few schemes from one Instance to another.

In source, I have Object Schemes A,B and C.

Object in Schema A are referencing objects from Schema B and C.

Importing Schemes B & C using the Insight Object Schema Import Type - all good.

I would like to be able to import from Schema A, maintaining the references to the Imported Objects in Schema B & C.

I was expecting the unique "External Hash Key" to be the same on the objects in Schemas B & C - as retrieved in the Datalocator for the referenced Attribute, but this is not the case.

I would like to have the Unique "External Hash Key" indicated in the Referenced Attribute as it appears on the Referenced Objects themselves, so that I can adjust my Import Configuration manually, to reference the corresponding imported Object Types, and keep the references in the Imported Schema A, by configuring the IQL:

"External Hash Key" = ${datalocator} 

At the moment, I have a different Hash value in the Referenced Attribute than the Referenced Object: 

Object in Schema A, Referenced Attribute datalocator: c125754aaba6c418c7c5edfb3dfea9e5

The imported Object from Schema B, referenced above, has "External Hash Key"=58ca2f7b6c82562eaadf29a6e7d4b835
fields.summary: Improve the Object Schema Import Type - References to other Schemas

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have configured Reports i Jira, and the feature that most people using Reports ask for is being able to click on value in the report and bein able there to se the details.This so we are able to break down the lists in the reports.For example:Having a asset object scheme that all the computers are listed in a objectType. Add attributes to that objectType with e.g. Model, OS Name, installed applications etc.Then configure a report (e.g. "Attribute value count report") filtering Object type Computer, and Attribute Operation System.We now get a nice reports that lists how many computers having the different operating systems. Here we want to be able to click the bar/pie-piece for a specific column, e.g. "Windows 10 Enterprise" and be given a list over all computers in that column.This list can be presented as a "Search" in Insight, or a filtered result inside the object Scheme.Would be great that this feature also would be present in the Dashboard gadgets.
fields.summary: Reports - Make report charts interacive/clickable to breakdown

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Because of high usage of CPU when user pick reference depth 4 or 5. Please allow admin to limit max reference depth for Object graph view.
fields.summary: Limit Reference depth in Object Graph View

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I want to know If there is any option to import ODATA archives from URL into Insight.And if this doesn't exist, Is it possible to add this functionality? Thank you in advance
fields.summary: ODATA importer

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When using a REST call, you should set the UserKey in order to populated a User Type Attribute.in Jira 7, new users were created using their email address, hence the email address became their userKey.The Company has changed its Domain, and all email addresses were updated, yet in order to populate a User Type Attribute using REST, onme must indicate the old email address, while the User's email is different, now belonging to the new domain...this is both confusing and hard to maintain.In additiona, the GDPR changes in Jira will migrate all userKeys to JIRAUSERnnnnn ...As a User's email is unique, it will be highly desirable to be able to set a user Attribute using the User's Email address.
fields.summary: Allow populating a User Attribute using the User's email

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,This feature request is to extend your public Java API to help us solve more problems programmatically. Specifically, there are parts of Insight that are not covered right now: * Creation and updating of an Insight field config (it links the field with object schema) * Creation and managing of automation rules * Creation of object schema rolesThere might be other part not covered, but these are needed the most at the moment. I hope you will look into developing these.Best Regards,Damir
fields.summary: Extend public Java APIs

fields.description: *Justification:* It is better to provide regular schedular (able to use CRON timer) to send out the report regularly

fields.description: It would be great if there would be an action "update issue" within the insight automation framework.It should be possible to directly limit it to the connected issues of the object which triggered the automation rule, or simply giving the possibility to use JQL (with the object as variable) to select the issues to be updated.

fields.description: Hello!Currently, Insight show only part of old and new value for long-string values. Can you make an option to show full value?

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello Team,As it seems, when moving to Data Center, there is no way to get the Insight Logs inside the Jira Support ZIP. With the server version this is possible.This is big issue, because the power users, that create Insight Imports are mostly not the same as the IT Staff managing a Data Center Cluster. Power users will most likely not have access to an actual virtual machine to download the logs by themselves. This makes the support process for data center very complicated and long.Options could be: * Logs become again available in the Support ZIP * Dedicated Insight Log Download Option similar to the Support ZIP * Better In-App Error Reporting instead of downloading logsI would prefer the last option to be honest.Looking forward to your proposals and feedback.Andreas
fields.summary: Better Insight Logs Access for Jira Data Center

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Companies with Large systems need to minimize the number of connections used to their Server.While you can import JSON - you will still have to form the JSON File response in advance...It will be nice to have a BULK POST API, where an external system can POST multiple objects in one call
fields.summary: Have a REST API to Bulk POST objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi!  Could you update, please the next dependency for 8.4.2 release of insight plugin? {noformat}<dependency> <groupId>net.sf.ehcache</groupId> <artifactId>ehcache</artifactId> <version>1.2.3</version></dependency>{noformat}As it was release so long time agohttps://mvnrepository.com/artifact/net.sf.ehcache/ehcache/1.2.3into new one https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.ehcache/ehcacheOr remove permanently if it does not used anymore that dependency, Or make it provided,  as it's already on Jira Server/Datacenter.
fields.summary: Cleanup of bundle inside-8.4.2

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: *Justification:* Similar as ScriptRunner Registry, it is convenience for Jira Admin to look up all Groovy script from workflow validator/condition/post-function in case for any update for Insight update (especially for 8.3 -> 8.4 version) due to API changed. *Reference:* [https://scriptrunner.adaptavist.com/latest/jira/builtin-scripts.html#_script_registry]
fields.summary: Script Registry

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: *Justification:* It is dangerous for having Insight Manager to delete the object type and all object data will lost. If possible, please remove this permission or provide better data backup method for Insight database to restore data. *Reference:* [https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSSERV/Insight+Permissions]
fields.summary: Remove Delete object type Permission from Insight Managers

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. ContextAutomation rules allow the system to work in a much more autonomous way, checking expiration dates, triggering the creation of issues when "something happens", etc.But many times, the automation rules suffer changes affecting their outcome or, even worst, the CMDB Scheme suffers changes (attribute names, mainly) that impacts on the rule behavior, and therefor, you need to adjust the automation rules.Unfortunately, there is no audit log for what happens with the automation rules.h2. UsecaseAdministrators would like to know things like: * Who created a given automation rule. * Who modified a given automation rule. * When a given automation rule was created or modified. * What was modified on the last edit. * Etc, etc, etc.h2. Prognosis.At the moment, this functionality is not available in Insight.  What happens on an automation rule, stays at the automation rule.h2. Suggested solution.As proposed on: * ICS-1425 * ICS-1343 * ICS-635Improve the Audit/automation capabilities of the product.
fields.summary: As Insight Admin I'd like to have audit logs from automation rules

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: *Scenario:* * Object with two attributes: ** "Go-Live approved" *** Select List with options "yes", "no" ** "Go-Live date" *** Date field*Goal:* * Make "Go-Live date" mandatory _if_ "Go-Live approved" = "yes"
fields.summary: Object Attributes: Modify attribute settings based on other attribute's values

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Présentement, les places holder s'il sont vide un novalue apparait. on veut retourver le comportement des versions précédente. Donc si un place holder est vide, il ne devrait pas y avoir de valeur No value sur les labels templates
fields.summary: Quand un champ est vide, on ne devrais pas voir No Value quand on imprime un label templates

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Use case:I have an existing object with an attribute (e.g. Object or User type) with 2 values in it.I want to update my Object and add a 3rd value.Current Situation: the PUT API (Object / Attribute) will remove the previous 2 values, and will replace them with the 3rd value only.It will be nice to add an optional param: e.g. Append = True to the Attribute Value, so that the end result will be: the Attribute is having 3 values.
fields.summary: REST API - add Append param when using PUT to update an Object's Attribute

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: While the Insight Groovy Script Validator has the configuration to customize the Error message and Field to associate it with - if the Validator fails, this is not available for the Calidator: Validate on Object Attribute.!image-2020-05-08-14-35-36-030.png|width=574,height=171!As the  Validator already has a Source CF configured, it will be nice to have the ability to edit the Error message to show if it fails.Currently, a Generic Message will show:"It seems that you have tried to perform an illegal operation. If you think this message is wrong, please contact your Jira administrators."
fields.summary: Insight Validator - Validate on Object Attribute, Customized Error Message.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. SummaryThe CSV file exported from Insight does not include BOM. This can be validated by trying to open the file directly in excel with a non unicode character. Choosing to save the file from sublime text for example with BOM corrects this.h2. RequirementAdd a configuration in the objects export functionality to include BOM with the CSV
fields.summary: Add BOM to CSV export

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,we are trying your Discovery, but we notice that there aren't Data Normalization and Enrichment functions.If the system founds two different entries like "Windows Service Pack 1" and "Windows SP1" how it recognizes that they are the same item?Furthermore, info about the software life cycle could be very useful, information such as application end of life are very important in asset management, how we can add that information on what discovery finds?
fields.summary: Import Data Normalization

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi there!We'd need a new feature to be added to the permissions role management. We would like to share the inventory we have set up, but as you may know, the object schema view isn't as fancy as the search object view. We configured several filters to cover the users needs, and in case someone need something more specific, we would modify/create the filter and share it with them.We would like to ask if there's a way to set up a custom role that allows the users to only access the search for objects tab.Thanks!
fields.summary: Search Only Permission

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have hundreds of types in our schema, and each type may have many attributes. Right now, the only way to order the types or the attributes is to hold and drag. Such way is extremely slow and painful.Suggestion:Add a changeable order number to the type and attribute meta fields. This integer should be at least 4 digit wide. The Insight admin can change the type order, or the attribute order of a type, by setting and resetting the order number.An example of type ordering:1001 type 11211 type 52305 type 217... Note that this type order number is different from my suggestion in ICS-1391 "grouped view of types". The group view should allow a type to be viewable in multiple groups. These two features can support each other as follows.Assume the type grouping view is enabled by two meta fields associated with the type: TypeGroupOrder, TypeGroupName. And the type order is set by one meta field TypeOrder.The following example shows the relationship:TypeGroupOrder, TypeGroupName, TypeOrder, TypeName100, Common Types, 1001, Category100, Common Types, 1011, Glossary100, Common Types, 1012, Glossary Item100, Common Types, 1023, Time Range200, Production, 1003, Goal200, Production, 1023, Time Range200, Sales, 1003, Goal200, Sales, 1023, Time Range… … In the example, type are firstly grouped and ordered by group order, then ordered with in a group by TypeOrder. A type will have one type order number. But a type can be part of multiple type groups for viewing.
fields.summary: Add an Order Number to Put Attributes and Types into Desired View Orders Quickly

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: As a User, when configuring a JSON import, I would like to have the option to get a Datalocator for the Object's Position in an Array of Objects, for example:For the JSON:{"ordernr" : "1234","orderitems" : [{ "itemname" : "a" },{ "itemname" : "b" }]}If I use the Selector "orderitems", I want to have a datalocator to map to an Attribute:Position >>> IDSo that the result of the Import will be 2 objects:itemname = aID = 0 itemname = bID = 1  More details here:[https://portal.mindville.com/plugins/servlet/desk/portal/12/RPS-15716]
fields.summary: Allow adding the Array Position as a Datalocator to a JSON import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be really useful to display numeric attribute values with thousand separators. Would be great to have a checkbox for this like in excel.
fields.summary: Display numeric attribute values with thousand separator like 1,234,567 or 1 234 567

fields.description: We are setting up import configurations using the JSON connection with a file URL, user name and password.  Our information security processes will require us to change passwords on a regular basis.We would like to build automation to perform our password rotation.
fields.summary: Add an API endpoint for updating import configurations

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi there,Is there a way to translate/ change the 'Search for an object' text in an Insight Object/s custom field on the customer portal of a JSD project?
fields.summary: Translate 'Search for an object' in Insight Object/s custom field

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello, when I select the magnifying glass icon next to the insight custom field I would like to search for objects by the attributes of their referenced objcts. Now only a simple text search field appears but it is not possible to do this type of search. How can I do? It could be a new feature?thanks
fields.summary: Select object by referenced objects attributes in the "Choose Object" Pop-Up

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When configuring a JSON import, if the JSON includes nulls, these will be imported as string values "null" into any Text Attribute, while the Value "" will be correctly imported as no value.The Use Case:Using a REST API, I get a JSON response.I want to use the Import to Populate a Text Attribute, using two or more datalocators, for example:Datalocators: platformname, platformversion to the Attribute: OS Name (Text):  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! this import will result in the Attribute "OS Name": "Windows 98 - null"The expected behavior for this case should be: "OS Name": "Windows 98"If the JSON has "platformversion":"" - this will be correct, however, the JSON is a response from a 3rd party application, and cannot be formatted to replace null with ""....
fields.summary: JSON null to be imported as ""

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Keyword inventory:In a Jira/JSD ticket there should be the possibility to scan several Insight objects in order to make assignments. Example from a customer application in geriatric care: # Reassignment: assign bed 123 to room A Example: Step 1 - Scan room A QRStep 2 - Scan bed 123 QR Assignment should be made via PostFunction # Change of assignment: bed 123 is moved from room A to room B Example: Step 1 - Scan room A QRStep 2 - Scan bed 123 QRStep 3 - Scan room B QR Change should be done via PostFunction # Deleting the assignment: bed 123 is taken from room B and disposed of Example: Step 1 - Scan room B QRStep 2 - Scan bed 123 QR Deletion of the assignment is to be done via PostFunctionThe aim is to make it as easy as possible for the end user to assign Insight objects by using the QR scan.This example can be applied to any other use cases, such as ITSM.
fields.summary: Multi QR Code Scan in Jira/JSD-Ticket

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: A large enterprise customer of ours is using Discovery to index their IT landscape.For some object types, e.g. database, there might be two or more objects with the same name, but running on different hosts. Here's an example:!1st_DB.png|width=527,height=259!!2nd_DB.png|width=479,height=236! In a separate object schema, they are tracking their internal applications. One of the attributes configured for this object type is database, which is an object picker field.When referencing a database in the edit object view, users cannot see any details but the name, so they cannot know what DB exactly they are linking:!edit_object_view.png|width=676,height=499!It would be great if this view could be modified to show more context info from the referenced objects, e.g. the "Host" field.
fields.summary: Edit object: Provide info about referenced objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Add a new attribute type, BLOB, to enable storing documents, images, etc. This could. for instance be used to store an image and scans of contract for an HR system.
fields.summary: New attribute type: BLOB

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello, on Trello you speak of "Attribute Types as Modules" [https://trello.com/c/H1CyoOPx/29-attribute-types-as-modules]=> please add support for Geo Location / Map coordinates (based on latitude/longitude)map view / selection of coordinates via map/satellite would also help a lot.This is following a customer request for Insight
fields.summary: Geo Location support (via a module ?)

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: A great trigger to add to the automation options would be when an Insight object is attached or removed from a Jira issue.For example, there are fields on an object that I want to copy to the Jira ticket when the object is added.Another example is that I want to capture the amount of time that an object was attached to a ticket. I have a use case where I attach an object at a certain transition and unattach it at another transition. An automation trigger would be easier to use than a script listener
fields.summary: New Automation Trigger Suggestion - Object attached to Jira Issue

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: After switching a client over to using Insight, it can be quite a pain to get read only fields back filled on old tickets. Please add a safe way in the front end that doesn't involve scripting, to back fill Insight read only fields based on JQL query, preferably with an ability to schedule the backfill. Also in a way that doesn't trigger notification schemes. thanks
fields.summary: A safe reliable built in way of back filling Read Only fields

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When we anonymize the Jira application data([https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/anonymising-jira-application-data-938847706.html]), Object's Attributes, carrying information which is not part of the entities.xml will be kept as is. Please implement anonymization of this data.
fields.summary: Anononymize insight custom field attribute when anonymize the Jira application data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h2. UsecaseSetup a [Email user(s) based on attribute in a selected Insight Object  |https://documentation.mindville.com/display/INSSERV/Insight+Post+Functions#InsightPostFunctions-Emailuser(s)basedonattributeinaselectedInsightObjectplaceholders-emailusersbasedonattribute]postfunction. Add the sender address as a non unicode character (for example using Russian alphabet). The sender will be be displayed incorrectlyh2. RequirmentAdd support for non unicode characters in the sender address
fields.summary: Post function - Sender address in post function does not support non unicode characters

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be really useful to be able to create Groovy Script objects within the Insight GUI and be able to link them directly to an automation action instead of having to link with a file location.This is useful for times when Jira/Insight users are admins on Jira but don't have admin access to the actual server machine.  So they can create and use Groovy Scripts directly through Insight itself.
fields.summary: Create, Manage, and Reference Groovy Scripts through Insight UI

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,I wanted to suggest an Improvement for Insight Automations. Right now it is only possible to set the absolute path to the script that is used in Insight Automations but it would be better if this could be changed to use relative paths (relative to the Script Roots directory or the jira-home directory) and similarly to setting scripts for scriptrunner to offer an auto completion of the available scripts.With this, 2 problems could be solved:1.) In case for a staging set-up with 2 or more instances where the path to the Jira-Home directory varies, it is not necessary to adapt the paths for each instance.2.) Eliminate the possibility of typos
fields.summary: Insight Automation - Relative Path

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: It would be great if the IP Address default attribute type field could be configured with cardinalities greater than 1 so that it can be used to store multiple IP addresses for servers with multiple interfaces, etc. This would help to be able to search one attribute for addresses instead of multiple attributes.
fields.summary: IP Address attribute type allows Cardinality greater than 1

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi,we have some Custom Fields (type: Insight Object/s) that display a lot of objects (> 10.000) which make a well functioning search function essential.For example: *Customer Contacts*In the Issue Creation Screen we want to search for three attributes (First Name, Last Name, Email Address). Therefore we have added all three attributes to the Custom Field configuration:!image-2020-09-23-13-37-39-098.png! When we search for a specific word like "Lange", we get a lot of different results in a confusing (not helpful) order:!image-2020-09-23-13-40-44-766.png! Sometimes the email address is marked bold, sometimes the last name and so on.It would be more helpful if we would have more control over the order of the search results. For example: full matches in the first attribute (Last Name) would be displayed at the top of the list, partial matches in the first attribute would be displayed afterwards, full matches in the second attribute afterwards, and so on.
fields.summary: Improve Insight Object Search in Custom Fields

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: add support for ssh:// links in insightIn Insight it was possible to add ssh:// links in to a text-area field and it was shown as a link and clickable.Our customer (and sister-company) [www.42.nl|http://www.42.nl/]  would like this functionality back in Insight. See https://portal.mindville.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/12/RPS-18197
fields.summary: add support for ssh:// links in insight

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to have the ability to see more details of when selecting an object reference when in insight from the drop-down list.For example, I have a application portfolio object, which has a department reference. For my department object, it has entity references because I could have 2 or 3 departments with the same name, but belong to 2 or 3 different entities. So I'm not sure of which entity I'm selecting in insight.The jira object type custom field that you have works perfect for this when in a custom field configuration because I can select multiple fields to display in the drop down list.!image-2020-09-30-06-46-22-999.png!
fields.summary: Object attribute field selection when in Insight

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently the widget will only display 12 objects before a scroll bar is presented. The insight widget stays the same size, meanwhile the user has to scroll. Also, if only 1 or 2 objects are wanted to be displayed, the widget windows takes up a lot screen estate. *Expected results:*Widget should be dynamic, either set by user in "Edit" or by auto. *Actual results:*Widget size is set no matter the number of objects.
fields.summary: Make widget dynamic and allow more objects to be displayed before scroll bar appears

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Request from our customers:Allowing the configuration of a Text Attribute to be a "Tooltip", so that when a Customer is hovering over the object selected in a CF, the Tooltip may show more information regarding the object, for example:If the customer can select a Priority Object in a Request CF, the selection will be made by the Object's Label, e.g. "Priority 2" - which does not mean much (well, more than P1, but less than P3...)If I can configure a Text Attribute, set to be used as Tooltip (the suggested feature), with the string value: "Critical loss of system functionality with no workaround provided." hence, explaining what P2 is all about.So, during Selection or once this Object is selected in a CF, if you hover over it, you will be able to read the additional information as a tooltip.
fields.summary: Configure a Text Attribute as "Tooltip"

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We use Insight to track physical and digital pieces of evidence as they move around our lab. We have started to create 'labels' which are really single-page reports in the evidence attributes (see attached screenshot). This works well for us, however, we would like to be able to include a text version of the 'comments' associated with the object. Is is possible to add a [[COMMENTS]] placeholder that simply converts the comments to a block of text, with: - comment date - user Firstname, Lastname and jira username - text - blank line separating each commentFor example:[2020-02-01 13:04:02] John Smith (jsmith@gmail.com) Took evidence from storage for analysis[2020-02-01 15:24:06] John Smith (jsmith@gmail.com) returned evidence to storage.
fields.summary: Insight Object Comments in Labels Interface

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Whether it is possible to disable control of compliance of required attributes when importing objects.Often, we need to update one or more attributes for an object type, but have to match required attributes or turn off mandatory, load data, and turn mandatory back on. Otherwise, the import configuration cannot be enabled.It would be easier if we could manipulate this parameter and ignore the required attributes on import
fields.summary: Import and required attributes

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently the Object Search on Insight's Custom Field (Dropdown/select) yields the results based 'LIKE' (contains).Can we add new configuration to control this behavior? Need the search results based on the 'STARTSWITH' IQL when a customer types in.
fields.summary: Insight Custom Field on Portal - Object Search

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hi team,we would like to have an enhancement to import configuration in order to be able to choose if overwrite or add new informations to an attribute when you have more import sources.We found that when importing, the values ​​read from the various lines (of the CSV or of the DB, the behavior is the same) all the values are appended to the attribute: for example if there are 2 lines in the CSV, one with product = " Product 1 "and the other with product =" Product 2 " the result is that in the attribute of the " PRODUCT object"you will find both products (“ Product 1 ",” Product 2 "). However, if a second import is then performed with a different source, the result is that the values ​​previously present in the attribute are removed, and replaced by the new value .It would be great to have the possibility to choose if overwrite or add new informations to an attribute when you have more import sources. BR
fields.summary: Ability to choose if overwrite or add new informations when you perform import from different sources

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,I know it is possible to view Insight inventory data in Jira service desk but is it possible through appropriate screen and fields in service desk to create new object in Insight?I don't see anything about it.thank you in advance Debaix Laurent.
fields.summary: Is it possible to Create a new Object from Service desk

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When you use a specific DB (postgres) scheme in Jira, Insight don't take it into consideration and it's mandatory to use the "public" sheme. Can you allow Insight to to be installed on custom schema names ?UI Error messages :- IllegalStateInsightException: Unable to determine existing objects identifiers will not continue import (during sync)- Contact your administrator (when showing objects type)Log Error :- Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: relation "AO_8542F1_IFJ_OBJ_ATTR_VAL" does not existProblem :- Object schema cannot be deleted- After a clean of insight the schema is not importable- After a synchronization on the DEV the "contact your administrator" problems reappear- You cannot modify the key of an object schema- Problems appear after reindexing insight- When the bug is present the search also does not work
fields.summary: As a system administrator, I want to use a specific database sheme so that i can respect best practices

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Can you please add something like "was" operator, so I can search like:"Name was John" and get all objects that had Name Attribute value "John" earlier?
fields.summary: Add "Was" IQL operator to search attribute have value in object history

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Can you please add history section with references changes?Example:1) I have object with type User - John.2) I have object with type Computer - Laptop. This object have attribute Owner, which set with value John. It is outbound reference from computer to user.3) If someone change Laptop's owner, it can be noticed in Laptop object history, but I can't see any information about John's hardware from John object view page. Cause there is no history for inbound references.Can you add history for inbound references changes? (add, remove)
fields.summary: Add object references history

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: h3. Problem DefinitionIn Object detail view, if the number of connected issues is very large (600K in my example), when user clicks on 'Show all filtered issues' in 'Connected Jira issues' panel, a JQL with all the issues connected runs and according to result-set it may cause memory pressure and Jira may become unresponsive.h3. Suggested SolutionUsing pagination to show all issues in order to decrease the impact of the running JQL.h3. WorkaroundThere is no workaround.
fields.summary: As an Insight user, I need pagination for Connected Jira Issues

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: From our Customer:They have 12 + Azure Import configurations in their Schema - for different Subscriptions.They would like to have an option to Enable / Disable a specific OT Map across ALL the import Configurations.
fields.summary: Bulk Actions for Import Configuration

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When viewing an object's force graph with reference depth set to 1, and *selecting a reference type that has outbound references to objects of the same type as the object selected*, Insight will check for objects with Outbound References of a specific type, *so all objects will be shown, as they are all of the same level/reference depth.* This can cause the graph to be unusable and slow if too many references exist.h3. Use case:We have two object types, "User" & "Group". "Group" has an attribute "Member" which can have an unlimited number of "User" objects set as a value. If we view a force graph for a "User" object and choose to view reference type "Member", the "Group" objects appear but also shows all of the other "User" objects referenced from them.Example(i) The "User" Object has the Users icon, and the "Group" Objects have the Lightning Logo.View from the "User" object:!UservView.png|thumbnail!View from the "Group" object:!GroupView.png|thumbnail!h3. Scenario:Object B references multiple Object A through the same attribute. Open force graph for Object A, select the reference type with Reference Depth set to 1.h3. Expected Result:The graph shows Object B references to selected Object Ah3. Actual Result:The graph shows Object B references to Object A, and all other Object A referenced by all the Object B which reference the one selected Object A.
fields.summary: Insight force graph will show all outbound referenced objects when they have a common incoming reference and are all of the same level/reference depth.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Request
Allow object schema key to be changed from the UI

h3. Why is it important
It's not possible to change the object schema key without via database (which is unsupported). If it's necessary to change the object schema key, it's recommended to export the objects and import them into a new schema with the intended key. 

However, exporting and importing will create new object keys, existing configurations like imports and automations are not transferrable. The connections between objects and Jira issues are also not copied in this case. In short, there's no feasible way to change the object schema key but it's important to be able to change it without other impacts.
fields.summary: Change object schema key

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Given the following external data source (CSV in this case) {code:java}Key;Name;Software;Created;UpdatedTASS-34;Computer;MS Office||Acrobat Reader;11.07.2016;25.09.2017{code}And 2 object types in Insight (*_Computer_* and *_Software_*) be able to import the above into the *_Computer_* object type and reference the *_Software_* identified by the IQL {code:java}Name in (${Software${0}}){code}Create the objects of type *_Software_* if they are missing.  In the above case with all object types empty at the start the result should be1 *_Computer_* object referencing 2 *_Software_* objects with the labels _MS Office_ and _Acrobat Reader_
fields.summary: Automatically create referenced objects if missing when using import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: For an reservation system, it would be nice to create named resource pools using the build-in query language. Here, each field defined for a resource should be usable. The actual resources will then be dynamically evaluated.By adding a name to such a pool, a person who is looking for a specific resource can be easily guided.An example could be the following: * Resource 1: Windows OS, Eclipse IDE, Working Student * Resource 2: Windows OS, Eclipse IDE, Working Student * Resource 3: Windows OS, Eclipse IDE, Fixed Position * Resource 4: Windows OS, Visual Studio, Working Student Two groups may look like the following: * Group "Working Students Project A" would be defined by Windows OS, Eclipse IDE, Working Student ** Bookable resources are 1 and 2 * Group "Working Students Project B" would be defined by Windows OS, Visual Studio, Working Student ** Bookable resource is 4
fields.summary: Create named resource pools to be bookable

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Insight is already equipped with a role concept to manage resources. For a reservation tool, we would foresee the following roles: * Admin is able to do everything * Management is able to see (filterable) bookings of users with the ability to change them * Team lead is able to see (filterable) bookings of users without ability to change them * User is only able to see and manage his own bookings
fields.summary: Role concept for resource booking

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Insight is already equipped with a versioning for the single assets. This should be also possible for an audit-proof reservation system covering filter aspects by user or by asset. This should minimise exploitation by users.
fields.summary: Versioned bookings on resources

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: To foster a smooth reservation process, an user interface with the following aspects should be envisioned: * Calender-centric view of own bookings with the possibility to create new reservations * Resource-centric view of own bookings with the possibility to create new reservationsIt should be possible to select one or more [resource pools|https://jira.riada.se/browse/ICS-588] to be displayed in the above UIs.Further, the displayed time frame should be adjustable to be displayed or operated on.
fields.summary: Search interface for bookable resources

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The reservation system should also serve as an operational util for team leads and management. Here the following aspects are crucial: * Show bookings for specific users within a time frame * Show all bookings for specific resource pools within a time frame
fields.summary: Overview of bookings

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Currently it is not possible to filter the imported data on their object references using IQL as (now) stated in the documentation ([Insight Documentation|[https://documentation.riada.se/insight/latest/insight-manager-s-guide/import-and-synchronization/general-import-concepts#GeneralImportConcepts-ImportObjectTypeMappingImportObjectTypeMapping])|https://documentation.riada.se/insight/latest/insight-manager-s-guide/import-and-synchronization/general-import-concepts#GeneralImportConcepts-ImportObjectTypeMappingImportObjectTypeMapping]).] because object refences are created/evaluated after the filter IQL is executed. It is only possible to filter on normal attributes.This functionality would be really useful when splitting data records into multiple object types depending on various fields/references.h3. My specific case:I receive a csv file with different devices, their manufacturer, model, etc.Each of the columns is a separate object type (Devices, Manufacturer, Model, see attached screenshot).Each row in the csv can be of a different device type depending on its manufacturer: - manufacturer != "SomeManufactory1" -> Object Type = "DeviceType2" - manufacturer = "SomeManufactory1" -> Object Type = "DeviceType1"
fields.summary: Import: IQL on object references

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Is there a way to be able to create an Insight field, and rather than create another reference field, be able to have a reference field side by side to the original field? This would save a lot of screen real estate and would make things easier to visualize, especially withe reference fields.
fields.summary: Insight Fields Side by Side

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Requesting a way to replace an entire word or phrase value in a particular attribute with a different word or phrase. Sometimes the verbiage in the source system is not what we want to display in Insight and it would be helpful to able to replace one constant value with another.
fields.summary: Allow for word/phrase replacement on import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: When making an object graph, it lists other items that I would not like listed. Can it not list just the items specifically related to it rather than everything related to it. Attached I would like it to only list the Green and not the Red items. Hopefully I make sense.
fields.summary: Object Graph lists irrelevant connections

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: The time taken to delete the records is very long. It takes even more time for importing the schema as is. Please have the performance improved.
fields.summary: Longer time to delete and import data

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: There should be some kind of error handling for automations apart from the log, so that it's easy to see the result of the rules, latest runs, if something is broken etc.

fields.description: Status of import modules like (Insight Discovery) are missing until they are existing in the import data.All possible Status should be added and available by default.

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: We have the need of defining labels (or other fields) in various languages.We operate a multilingual service desk and our customers should be able to select assets (i.e. products and their description) in a request item in their own language.These translations should also somehow be available for imports.Creating the same asset structure in different languages to solve this would in my opinion defeat the purpose of the CMDB as single source of truth.Regards,Michael
fields.summary: Multilingual labels/fields

fields.description: There are a few changes that can affect several objects (removing an attribute or an object type, deliberate bulk actions), but there are no matching undo functions. Is there any "version control"-feature on the horizon for Insight with a possibility to revert changes? (Saving/restoring the entire Object Schema is sometimes too course.)

fields.description: My feature request would be to have a mechanism in the Custom Field in JIRA that would allow it to show only objects related to the reporter if it's displayed in the Customer Portal, but beyond that, in JIRA Service Desk I would like to allow the asignees to be able to select any asset at all. I just want to limit users of the Customer Portal and not the techs.

fields.description: There should be some kind of indication showing if a configuration is applied to an object type attribute, import mapping etc., so it is easy to see if it is used a regex or any other OOB-settings is changed.This would also make it easier and less error prone when moving functionality from one environement to another.

fields.description: Hey Insight team,As the subject suggests - we would be very happy if you could implement an option to choose the divider for multiple values in a .csv import. Currently the double pipe is the only option.The documentation is a bit vague on this subject:_"To divide multiple values (for the Insight Attributes with multiple cardinality), use || (2 pipe characters). This may be changed in the future, so you can select your own divider."_[https://documentation.riada.se/insight/latest/insight-manager-s-guide/import-and-synchronization/import-types/csv-import]We have .csv exports coming out from a system where we cannot change the divider to a double pipe. Would be great if we could configure this in the same way as the concatenator. Instead of having to massage the data before importing.Peace,Emil
fields.summary: Option to configure divider for multiple values in the Import

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: A few of our customers have requested the following feature:Being able to see the history of previously assigned objects to a user (resource). E.g: Benjamin uses a iPhone X now, but what was his previous phone? The only option for this is to 'retire' the object (the previous phone) and keep it assigned, but that's not really a feasible solution in many cases (think off temp. phones/laptops for instance).Snippet from the e-mail with Alexander Sundström [Riada]: Hi Edwin,As Insight is implemented today, there is no specific resource, to get the user targeted history of assigned objects. I would recommend to create a feature request for this at [jira.riada.se|http://jira.riada.se/], thanks for the suggestion  !https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=f01a9fc847&attid=0.1.1&permmsgid=msg-f:1594195749785990308&th=161fb896886e74a4&view=fimg&sz=w1600-h1000&attbid=ANGjdJ-zX0jdOfP__7Ws-Ewt-MBjyHz9LwF9Ma64IGWbpRIa_pK3wWtAf1krXpTeGhNGAuKAH-TWszeKpdJItRnYrm-AVAQmr0i-ONfmWWA6-EfkWRmzBfdrnZ9h7eA&disp=emb|width=16,height=16,align=absmiddle!Best RegardsAlexander
fields.summary: Get the user targeted history of assigned objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,currently when importing items with a 'JIRA User' attribute assigned and this User is not in one of the correct groups, it will not create the object at all.I would rather have the object created without the JIRA User assigned than not created at all.Best regardsThomas
fields.summary: Import - accept invalid 'JIRA User' fields without cancelling the import

In the Certifications object I have created a new attribute called Employee and linked it to the Employee object.Now I want to create a new automation rule where I want to send an email to the employee when the certification expires. From the current setup, I cannot do this since the Employee in the certification is an object and not a user.The new feature that I'm requesting is to allow sending emails to attributes of type object if they has for example an email attribute in them.

fields.description: Hello,We have a client who asks us to provide *Insight attributes* that would be translated depending on the user preferences (as set in the JIRA profile), in the same manner as Custom Fields or other JIRA placeholders can be translated.This does not seems to be currently available, but would be really useful for multi-lang environments.Thanks in advance for your help and understanding. NB : * this is +not+ a duplicate of ICS-640, ICS-41, ICS-39 since we here refer to the "attribute name" and not the content of an attribute field.

fields.description: As per RPS-6048 and discussed with @Fredrik Karbing:As a implementer/admin of Insight I would like to have some way to allow multiple imports with creating referenced objects during imports.Assumptions are that:1. It would work for both references in one scheme and cross-scheme ones2. not necessarily it require creation of new objects, it might be sequencing imports based on required references

fields.description: Not sure if this is a valid forum for me. If not, please let me know.I have a schema for our CMDB that I am building. I have a server object, and an application object. I have an attribute in each called "Maintenance Window' that is set to Type "Status" & Type Value "Disabled"I would like the following scenario to happen:When an admin or app owner edits their objects (their Server, or their Application - respectively) - I want them to change the status to "Enabled" and then have the following happen:In the edit window, additional object types appear when the status of the "Maintenance Window" attribute value type is "Enabled" so they can select their preferred Maintenance Window schedule based on a "Maintenance Window" object that I have created. Thanks
fields.summary: Conditional choices based on attribute status

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I would like to see the post function of auto referencing a insight attribute to become a listener. Currently if I edit items on the issue I am then left with out of date custom fields. Can we have a listener feature made in order to update these fields

fields.summary: As I user I want my new object to be selected on jira issue automatically

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: I create an issue. the issue have two insight custom fields. The second is cascading from the first one. I choose a parent object, then I don't find an appropriate child so I click on create new object. In the create screen I want the object type selection to be preselected according to the parent selection on the JIRA issue.
fields.summary: As I user I want my cascading selection should apply when creating new related objects

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello,We would really benefit from an option to get the object graph as a table/list.Objects with many references are incredibly hard to see in the bouncy graph mode, we'd like an option to switch between graph and list mode, where some details about each referenced object to be presented (like name, object type, and maybe a few other customisable attributes). Thanks,Bogdan
fields.summary: Object "graph" in table mode

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: Hello, when working with Insight Object Custom Fields in JIRA and specifically “Context” it would be ideal to be able to “Copy” the Context as frequently we’re using all of the same information we’re just changing the: 1.        Project2.       ID to run a parameter on for what the field should return. Without this, we have to set the “Fields” over and over again.
fields.summary: Copy CF Field configuration from one context to the other

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when opening custom fields' Object picker, there is a Search bar where a user can search Objects based on keywords (e.g. part of name, Object Key, or some other field values). However, there is no way to do a precise search by using a full IQL search filter.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Implement an IQL search filter on the custom field Object picker form.

h3. Use case:
Our shipper has shipped 25 of our 1000 widgets to Margaritaville. He set the Location attribute for each widget to Margaritaville, and set the Batch attribute to '2018-06a'. He also shipped 50 widgets to Narnia, which are part of the same Batch, '2018-06a'. In Jira, he has created an Issue to track the shipment to Margaritaville. He would now like to add those widgets to the Issue. Clicking the magnifying glass beside the Issue's 'Widgets' custom field, he is presented with the object picker. He wants to find objects in Margaritaville from batch 2018-06a, so being a clever user he pastes in the IQL for this search, 'Location=Margaritaville and Batch=2018-06a' but receives the messageh3. "No objects found!No objects found! Try if possible to reduce filter scope!"In fact, I can't figure out a way to make this work at all. Searching for the two strings separated by a space does not appear to work, either.h3. The request:It would assist us greatly if the same search filter that is available within Insight was also available in the object picker, perhaps as an 'Advanced Search' option.Thank you for your time and consideration and also for creating such a great tool!
fields.summary: Full search filter in custom field's object picker

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description: *Use case:*We use Insight as an asset register, where an asset is created as an object. We maintain our assets within an object schema.*Problem description:*Mit der Zeit kann es vorkommen, dass Assets ausgeschieden werden. Ausgeschiedene Assets werden als solche mitteles eines Attributs gekennzeichnet, verbleiben zu Audit-Zwecken jedoch im Objekt Schema. Bei der täglichen Arbeit ist es jedoch ärgerlich bei der Auswahl eines Objekttyps immer die gesamte Liste der Assets präsentiert zu bekommen, wenn man sich jedoch nur einen Überblick über aktive Assets verschaffen möchte.Over time, assets may be eliminated. Eliminated assets are flagged as such using an attribute, but remain in the object schema for audit purposes. In the daily work, however, it is annoying when selecting an object type to always get presented the entire list of assets, but only to get an overview of active assets.*Feature description:*It would be advantageous if it were possible to configure a default filter per object type, which would hide these inactive objects accordingly. This standard filter should be easy to de-activate or re-enable by option and generally apply to all users.In addition, it would also be useful if inbound and outbound references would also consider these standard filters, thus, e.g. only show references to active objects.
fields.summary: Ability to configure default filters per object type
